sentences.english: Zhongyuan the time famine serious, extremely sharp class contradictions.
sentences.chinese: 其時中原災荒嚴重，階級矛盾極度尖銳。

sentences.english: Once a serious famine happen, the people leave immediately, flees from famine.
sentences.chinese: 一遇災荒，百姓旋即徙走，逃荒他處。

sentences.english: Millions of people died that way in famine.
sentences.chinese: 在災荒中，千百萬的人就這樣死了。

sentences.english: Famine and war have thinned down the population in this region.
sentences.chinese: 災荒和戰爭使該地區的人口減少。

sentences.english: The temporary philanthropic enterprise of the Red Swastika included redemptive activities in the time of war and famine.
sentences.chinese: 紅卍字會的臨時慈業包括戰事救助和災荒救助。

sentences.english: In god's punishment, famine and pestilence was full of Athens.
sentences.chinese: 在神的懲罰下，雅典正充滿災荒和瘟疫。

definition: Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
the country ruined and the people starving (idiom)
to accumulate/to gather/to amass wealth by heavy taxation or other unscrupulous means/(science) convergent
to die of old age/to live to a ripe old age/(fig.) (of sth) to come to an end (after a long period of service)
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to dispatch troops/to send an army/to mobilize forces
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
"the four classes" of ancient China, i.e. scholars, farmers, artisans, and merchants
using the few to defeat the many (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
